channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s National Security Strategy Document Is a Curious One
item.description: Being the strongest and most successful nation will mean ensuring that America First does not devolve into America Alone.

item.title: Campaign Finance And The First Amendment Take Center Stage At SCOTUS
item.description: In NRSC v. FEC, the court will decide the constitutionality of restrictions on coordinated spending between candidates and political parties.

item.title: ‘Gold-Standard’ Immigration Enforcement Bill Lagging In Indiana As Redistricting Sucks Oxygen
item.description: While Indiana's congressional redistricting efforts generate massive attention, an immigration bill the Trump administration supports is lagging.

item.title: Democrat wins Miami mayor's race for the first time in nearly 30 years
item.description: Democrat Eileen Higgins won the Miami mayor's race on Tuesday, defeating a Republican endorsed by President Donald Trump to end her party's nearly thr...

item.title: Zootopia 2 Teaches Kids They Have Trauma And It’s Their Parents’ Fault
item.description: Now Disney seems to be pushing the message that the happiest place on earth is as far away from your family as possible.

item.title: Trump slams media over coverage that he is 'slowing down'
item.description: President Trump reprimanded the press for reporting that he is losing his stamina.

item.title: DOJ cleared to release secret Jeffrey Epstein case grand jury materials
item.description: A federal judge cleared the release of grandjury documents from Jeffrey Epstein's 2019 sex trafficking trial on Wednesday.

item.title: International students skipped campus this fall — and local economies lost $1 billion because of it
item.description: Hosting 21,587 fewer new international students means 7,300 fewer jobs and $500 million in lost labor income.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump National Guard deployment in Los Angeles
item.description: The order from Judge Breyer returns the National Guard troops to the control of California Gov. Gavin Newsom.

item.title: Judge orders Trump to stop using California's National Guard
item.description: A federal judge accused President Trump on Wednesday of using National Guard troops to create a "national police force" and ordered him to relinquish ...

item.title: Documents: Wisconsin Judge In Trump Electors Case Didn’t Write His Own Ruling
item.description: Unsealed documents accuse retired Dane County Judge Frank Remington of ghostwriting Judge John Hyland's order rejecting a dismissal motion.

item.title: America’s mobile housing affordability crisis reveals a system where income determines exposure to climate disasters
item.description: California lost 239,575 residents in 2024, the most of any state, while the housing market requires a $237,000 household income for a midtier house.

item.title: Goldman Sachs CFO on the company’s AI reboot, talent, and growth
item.description: Goldman’s OneGS 3.0 revamp is underway.

item.title: Cotton moves to loosen rules to boost supply of household staple, ease affordability crunch
item.description: The Lowering Egg Prices Act would require FDA and USDA to rewrite egg-handling rules, potentially increasing egg supply and reducing consumer prices.

item.title: Medicare Prescription Drugs Could Cost $500 Billion More Than Expected Over The Next Decade
item.description: A blog post by Congressional Budget Office staff dropped a bombshell: Spending on Medicare prescription drug coverage has exploded.

item.title: Cause of death confirmed for Mitt Romney's sister-in-law
item.description: Former Sen. Mitt Romney's sister-in-law Carrie Elizabeth Romney's death has been ruled a suicide by the Los Angeles County medical examiner Tuesday.

item.title: Exclusive: Surf, an AI platform just for crypto, raises $15 million
item.description: The startup is backed by Pantera, Coinbase and DCG

item.title: KISS and Company at the ‘All-American’ Kennedy Center Honors
item.description: If Trump’s goal is to create a Kennedy Center for the people, then this year’s Honors ceremony seemed entirely designed to vindicate their tastes.

item.title: Political communication scholar on how Zohran Mamdani hacked ‘slacktivism’ to appear on your phone, on your street and in your mind
item.description: Campaigning increasingly occurs in what researchers call a “hybrid media” environment: in person, on the news and across multiple social media.

item.title: Mrs. Shakespeare, Credit Hog
item.description: The literal-minded Hamnet abandons cultural outreach.

item.title: Trump's economic reset collides with ballot box results as Democrats celebrate more wins
item.description: President Trump and Republicans woke up Wednesday licking their wounds after another bruising night at the ballot box.

item.title: The Effort to Tame Tech Is Bound to Fail
item.description: What Tristan Harris gets wrong.

item.title: Congressional Democrats widen 2026 battlefield, zero in on new House Republican targets
item.description: Democrats expand House battleground map to 39 seats for 2026 midterms, targeting Republican districts in California, Texas, Florida and North Carolina...

item.title: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore calls special session to elect new House speaker
item.description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore has called for a special session next week to pick a replacement for outgoing House Speaker Adrienne Jones.

item.title: The ‘Restrainers’ Get Their Consolation Prize
item.description: The administration’s National Security Strategy document would not create a safer world for Americans.

item.title: Corporate Myopia: Less-Frequent Reporting Won’t Reduce Managerial Short-Termism
item.description: Evidence shows quarterly reporting is not the cause of corporate myopia. Incentive structures exert far greater pressure. The post Corporate Myopia: L...

item.title: The Two AI Stories: Measurable Gains and Hidden Balance-Sheet Pressure
item.description: AI is boosting productivity, yet circular financing and concentrated capital flows raise valuation and balance-sheet risks. The post The Two AI Storie...

item.title: Reducing the Cost of Alpha: A CIO’s Framework for Human+AI Integration
item.description: How CIOs can slash costs, scale alpha, and modernize their investment engine with a high-impact Human+AI strategy. The post Reducing the Cost of Alpha...

item.title: Patience Pays: Why Quality Shares Outperform in the Long Run
item.description: Market timing rarely pays. Patience, and investing in high-quality companies, equal long-term outperformance. The post Patience Pays: Why Quality Shar...

item.title: The Earnings Dip Before a Sweet Deal: Going Private in Europe
item.description: European voluntary delistings often involve earnings management. This study shows the patterns and implications for investors. The post The Earnings D...
